doc:
Kim Hartman https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Kim_Hartman 0 Kim Lesley Hartman (born 11 January 1952) is an English actress, best known for her role as Private Helga Geerhart in the BBC television sitcom 'Allo 'Allo!.She was educated at The King's High School for Girls, Warwick. and the Webber Douglas Academy of Dramatic Art, London.In addition to 'Allo 'Allo!, Hartman's television acting credits also include Casualty and The Brittas Empire, The Kelly Monteith Show, Fifteen Storeys High, Miss Jones and Son and Grange Hill (3 series). Her stage work includes the West End stage production of 'Allo 'Allo!, Margaret in My Mother Said I Never Should, Vera in Stepping Out, Josie in Steaming (New Zealand), Philippa James in Double Double, Sheila in Relatively Speaking, Jacqueline in Don't Dress for Dinner (West End), Alison in Mum's the Word, Doris Wagstaff in the farce Dry Rot, Brigit in Sitting Pretty, Judith Bliss in Hay Fever and Vicky in My Fat Friend.Radio plays include Lord Sky, Mary Yellan in Jamaica Inn, Daisy Chain, a Sapphire and Steel audio drama and an audio book entitled The Worst Street in London. Hartman presented a travel programme shown on Travel Channel (UK), Cruising to the Northern Lights. Kim_Lesley_Hartman ( born 11_January_1952 ) is an_English_actress , best_known for her_role as Private_Helga_Geerhart in the_BBC_television_sitcom ' Allo_'_Allo ! . She was_educated at The_King 's_High_School for Girls , Warwick . and the_Webber_Douglas_Academy of Dramatic_Art , London.In_addition to '_Allo_'_Allo ! , Hartman 's_television_acting_credits also include Casualty and The_Brittas_Empire , The_Kelly_Monteith_Show , Fifteen_Storeys_High , Miss_Jones_and_Son and Grange_Hill ( 3_series_) . Her_stage_work includes the_West_End_stage_production of ' Allo_'_Allo ! , Margaret in My_Mother Said I Never Should , Vera in Stepping_Out_,_Josie in Steaming_(_New_Zealand_) , Philippa_James in Double_Double_,_Sheila in Relatively Speaking , Jacqueline in Do n't Dress for Dinner_(_West_End_) , Alison in Mum 's_the_Word , Doris_Wagstaff in the_farce_Dry_Rot , Brigit in Sitting Pretty , Judith_Bliss in Hay_Fever and Vicky in My_Fat_Friend.Radio plays_include Lord_Sky , Mary_Yellan in Jamaica_Inn , Daisy_Chain , a_Sapphire_and_Steel_audio_drama and an_audio_book entitled The_Worst_Street in London . Hartman presented a_travel_programme shown on Travel_Channel_(_UK_) , Cruising to the_Northern_Lights .
